newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Marriott to manage Philippines hotel.
newsitem.headline: Marriott to manage Philippines hotel.

text.p: The Ayala Group said on Tuesday it had signed a contract with Marriott Lodging, a division of Marriott International Inc, to operate a hotel in the Cebu province in the central Philippines.

Called the Cebu City Marriott Hotel, the 303-room hotel is expected to open in early 1998 after a two-year construction period. It is being built at a cost of over 1.0 billion pesos inside the 50-hectare Cebu Business Park, Ayala officials told reporters.
The hotel is owned by Cebu Insular Hotel Co, a 63-37 joint venture between Ayala Hotels Inc and Cebu Holdings Inc, both members of the Ayala Group.

"To date there are about 1,000 hotel rooms targeted available in Cebu city. Average occupancy rate has been estimated at 70 percent, a firm indication of the keen need for such accommodation," said Miriam Ramos, a director of Cebu Holdings.
Ed Fuller, executive vice president of Marriott International, said the project will help Marriott grow in the rapidly expanding Asian region. Marriott came to Asia only in 1991.
"Asia is a growing market. The Philippines is indicative of that. We're very excited about starting in this market," Fuller said.
Cebu Holdings Inc is owned 44 percent by Ayala Land Inc, while Ayala Hotels is half-owned each by Ayala Land and Ayala Corp, the group's flagship company.
The Marriott Group manages and operates more than 210,000 hotel rooms and 1,200 properties in 50 states in the United States and in 33 other countries, including three in Asia-Pacific.
